column1: Myślenice [mɨɕlɛˈɲit͡sɛ] is a town in southern Poland
column2: situated in the Lesser Poland Voivodeship (since 1999)
column4: 261 (2007). The town is divided into six districts. One of them
column6: is a popular tourist destination. It is located behind the Raba river (Zarabie meaning "Beyond the (River) Raba")

column1: Myślenice is located on the so-called Zakopianka Road
column2: which is a popular name of the European route E77 road
column3: connecting Kraków with Zakopane (the E77 itself separates itself from the Zakopianka at Rabka). Myślenice does not have a train station.

column1: First mentions of Myślenice come from 1253 - 1258. At that time
column4: designed to protect Kraków from the south. In 1342
column5: Myślenice received its Magdeburg rights town charter
column6: and it started to develop into a local commercial center. Among visitors who came here
column8: who wrote part of his Life of an Honest Man during his stay there; King Władysław II Jagiełło and Queen Jadwiga; German emperor Sigismund; and other personalities.  In 1557
column9: Myślenice came under the jurisdiction of Kraków castellans
column10: who were much more concerned with their city. The town began to decline
column11: and it was destroyed in the deluge. In 1772 (see Partitions of Poland)
column14: it belonged to the province of Galicia. After World War I
column15: the town became part of the Second Polish Republic. On 22 January 1945
column16: Myślenice was liberated by the troops of 38th Army of the 4th Ukrainian Front. Between 1975-1998 the city was part of the Kraków Voivodeship.

column1: Dalin Myślenice - women's volleyball team that has won Polish Seria B Women's Volleyball League in 2003/2004 season and was promoted to play in Polish Seria A Women's Volleyball League in 2004/2005 season.
CFL slotback Dave Stala was born here.
